WorkItem.Description:
I use the API documentation bundled with each release a lot, it is good to get a quick overview of the methods for the various classes.
 
Still, I am occasionally having trouble finding the various methods.
 
Example:
----
I want to look up a method for the PHPExcel_Worksheet class. So I open the API documentation in my browser (Documentation/API/index.html). Now I click on "PHPExcel_Worksheet" under packages thinking that this will somehow bring me to the list of methods for PHPExcel_Worksheet, but it doesn't. Rather, I have to click on "PHPExcel" under "Packages" which is a bit counter-intuitive.
 
Suggested fix:
----
Include the class file containing PHPExcel_Worksheet in the PHPExcel_Worksheet package instead of the PHPExcel package.
 
I believe that will make class PHPExcel_Worksheet display under "Classes" when you click on "PHPExcel_Worksheet" under "Packages".
 
I have similar suggestion for the other classes that are packages themselves.
 
What do you say? Is this against the conventions? I have no idea?
 
P.S: It is also hard to find the PHPExcel_Style class methods. That is because it is included in the Package "PHPExcel_Cell", instead I suggest putting it in the PHPExcel_Style package
 
Environment:
----
PHPExcel: 1.6.4

Comments.Message: Erik, you can go ahead and change package for more clear API documentation.
Ok great, Maarten, I'll take a look at it and post suggestion for changes before committing.
Have updated @package tags so API documentation will be more clear.
